Bicyclist killed in crash

Boston police said a bicyclist was killed in a collision with a vehicle in Allston near the intersection of St. Paul Street and Commonwealth Avenue.
 (Boston Globe, 9:46 a.m.)

Police step up patrols after robberies

Boston and Transit Police are increasing patrols after several women were robbed walking home from MBTA Red Line stations. (Globe, 10:54 a.m.)

"A Farewell to Bathtub Gin" was the theme last night at Repeal Night at The Hawthorne, which celebrated the 79th anniversary of the end of Prohibition.

Apple to produce line of Macs in US

In an interview with NBC's "Rock Center" Apple CEO Tim Cook said the company will produce one of its existing lines of Mac computers in the US in 2013. (AP, 9:34 a.m.)

Obama family to light National Christmas Tree

President Barack Obama and his family will flip the switch for the 90th annual lighting of the National Christmas Tree. This year’s giant blue spruce is new, transplanted in October on the Ellipse, south of the White House.
